roleset.name: fail to notice
roleset.note: OVERLOOK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'overlook' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from overlook.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Mr. Lehman overlooks the fact that the Navy possesses its own air force ( the carrier fleet ) and its own army ( the Marines ) , which in turn [*T*-1] has its own air force .
example.arg: the fact that the Navy possesses its own air force ( the carrier fleet ) and its own army ( the Marines ) , which in turn [*T*-1] has its own air force

example.name: passive
example.text: But [that rule]-1 is being virtually overlooked [*-1]by Wall Street , which [*T*-2] is concentrating on [*-3] coping with the deduction issue .
example.arg: by Wall Street , which [*T*-2] is concentrating on [*-3]coping with the deduction issue

roleset.name: be oriented in a certain direction
roleset.note: OVERLOOK-V NOTES: frames created by Olga (from overlook.02-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: In his office overlooking the runway of Shannon Airport , Mr. Ovcharenko enthusiastically throws out what he calls [*T*-1] `` just ideas '' :
